subject: Critical Thinking
title: The Planning Fallacy: Why Everything Takes Longer
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Planning Fallacy: Why Everything Takes Longer.

hook.text: The Sydney Opera House: estimated 4 years and $7M. Actual: 16 years and $102M. This happens to every project everywhere.

buildup.text: The planning fallacy: we consistently underestimate time, cost, and risk for projects while overestimating benefits.

discovery.text: Kahneman: we plan from the 'inside view' â€“ our specific project.

twist.text: Knowing about the planning fallacy doesn't fix it.

climax.text: The fix: 'reference class forecasting.' Find 10 similar projects. Use their average completion time, not yours.

punchline.text: Your estimate is wrong. Use history's estimate instead.

quiz.question: What is 'reference class forecasting'?
options: Using completion data from similar past projects to predict your own
Planning based on the best case scenario
